alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yellowstone National Park through 345 PM MDT... At 315 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harlequin Lake, or near West Yellowstone, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Madison, Firehole Canyon and Fountain Paint Pot around 320 PM MDT. Gibbons Falls, Norris Junction and Twin Lakes around 325 PM MDT. Virginia Cascade and Grebe Lake around 330 PM MDT. Canyon, Lower Falls and Cascade Lake around 335 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
